abortion is painful? are we talking about the child? if so, you are wrong... it most likely feels nothing. i won't get into detail (so not to scare the young ones), but it would be like jumping off of a building... you feel pain for 1/1000 of a second.

 
 The child feels no pain?! Have you heard of the abortion procedures? (100% of which are painful and last much more than "1/100 of a second"?!?!?) Here are some popular methods:
 
 Vacuum Aspiration or Sharp Curettage (D&C): (6 to 16 wks) powerful suction tube inserted
 through the cervix and into the uterus. The fetal body parts and placenta are sucked into a jar, the unbornchild often torn apart by the force of the suction. Possible complications include infection, cervicallaceration and uterine perforation. Details of an 11 week abortion (warning: some graphic material). 
 
 Mifepristone: (5 to 7 wks) is also known as RU-486 or the "Abortion Pill." This chemical causes an abortion by interfering with the function of the placenta, starving the unborn child to death. Prostaglandins (misoprostol, see below) are then administered to expel the fetus. This method of abortion takes place over the span of several days; the average woman using it bleeds heavily for more than nine days, but some women have bled for over four weeks. Because mifepristone is a new method, long term health risks are not yet known. 
 
 Methotrexate: (5 to 9 wks) though not approved by the FDA for this use, a methotrexate injection kills the unborn child by interfering with the growth process (cell division). Several days later, the woman is treated with prostaglandin (misoprostol) suppositories to expel the fetus; woman aborts at home. Requires three visits to a doctor to complete process. 
 
 
 Dilation & Evacuation (D&E): (13 to 20+ wks) the cervix is pried open. Using forceps, the abortionist tears the child out of the womb, limb by limb. The child is then reassembled to assure that no fetal parts are left inside. Possible complications include infection, cervical laceration and uterine perforation. 
 
 Prostaglandin: (16 to 38 wks) also called misoprostol, this chemical which induces premature labor, is given as suppositories or an injection; live births are common. Hazards include convulsions, vomiting, and cardiac arrest. 
 
 Digoxin Induction: (20 to 32 wks) involves injecting a lethal chemical directly into the baby's heart followed by labor induction with prostaglandin. 
 
 Saline Abortion: (16 to 32+ wks) a long needle is inserted into the woman's abdomen, and a salty solution is injected into the amnionic fluid. The salt poisons the child, burning its lungs and skin. A dead baby is then delivered within 24 hours. This method is rarely used any more due to the serious health risks to the woman. 
 
 Hysterotomy: (24 to 38 wks) like a c-section, an incision is made in the woman's abdomen. The baby is removed then allowed to die by neglect. This procedure carries the same health risks as a c-section. 
 
 D&X: (20 to 32+ wks) also known as "partial-birth abortion" this dangerous method of late abortion, termed "bad medicine" by the American Medical Association, involves pulling the baby out feet first into the birth canal while the head remains in the uterus. The abortionist then makes a hole in the back of the skull to remove the brains with a suction catheter. The head collapses allowing the child to be removed in one piece.

 i know you picture me with a constant frown on my face; a barbaric heathen. i am but the opposite; i smile way too much. i am proud to say i have no enemies. i am glad people see me as mister nice guy.
 
 i am happy, i see a future for myself (my life has hardly started), and i hope myself and others to have a meaningful life. what is "meaning"? it is self defined. your definition is "god"... but it isn't mine. again you inderectly put words in my mouth.
 
 i know you mean well an i do respect other people's religion (i may not seem to, but sometimes i am in a bad mood and take it out on here :P).
 
 anyway, goodbye, movietime for me, and i might be on later... i will reply.
btw, when i said congress, i ment "politicians".

So you are telling me that fetuses are "incapable of feeling-and-recognizing pain"? I'd like some evidence to back that statement up.
 
 
 Up until the 5th month, the brain isn't developed enough to feel pain.

i know you picture me with a constant frown on my face; a barbaric heathen.

 
 I do not! (I actually can't visualize what anybody here might look like.) But I wouldn't blame you if you visualized me as a frowning-Bible-thumping-self-righteous-cookie-cutter-Christian.:) 
 
 
Up until the 5th month, the brain isn't developed enough to feel pain.

 
 Proof? Evidence? Quotes? Anything?

I do not! (I actually can't visualize what anybody here might look like.) But I wouldn't blame you if you visualized me as a frowning-Bible-thumping-self-righteous-cookie-cutter-Christian.
 
 
 i'm glad you don't, but unlike you, i try to picture what everyone looks like :P. you, no, not a cookie-cutter christian. i picture you as a somewhat young suburbian girl whom is very proud and (obviously) defensive of her religion :).
 
 i don't see you at an evangelist, i knwo that becaus eone is on a forum, it is much easier to force your point of view onto others. i, myself, do this, although i am not called an evangelist... but only because i am, let's see... anti-religion. i don't kno what yo call that... and arrogant *******? well, i'll let you decide.

gilligan:
 
 That was a very good source, but even the scientists who did those tests were not 100% sure whether or not fetuses felt pain. ("There is no evidence specific pain fibres have grown into the spinal cord at 19 weeks, although this may be due to experimental difficulties with
 small fetus neurones.") We should continue this debate under the abortion forum. (If you want to, that is.)
good deal, we will... but i have to jet right now, later!

Originally posted by Calligirl 
 
 How am I "guilting people" and "putting people down"? I said that gilligan's view of life was sad. Gilligan has no hope for the future and no meaning to his life (or anyone else's). That makes me want to cry! :( I feel sad for him. I\'m not trying to put him down, I\'m trying to show him the hopelessness of life without Christ, what\'s wrong with that?
 

 
 So life is always hopeless without Christ? It\'s not an individual thing? Let\'s look at an earlier quote from you in this thread:
 
 
Originally posted by Calligirl 
 
 The free will to do as we chose is what keeps us from being robots. Not hate. Think about it, we could still love without hate. We could also hate without love. But without the free will to chose to do right or wrong, we would be robots.
 

 
 When you begin to see how you are being hypocritical, people will stop harrassing you.

wjim1269 -
 
Bush may not have won the popular vote, but he won the electoral vote, which is how the President is elected.
 
 
 Bush didn\'t win the electoral vote, even us lot in Britain know that.

Dirtynumbangel,
 
 
 "Bush didn\'t win the electoral vote, even us lot in Britain know that."
 
 - What in the world are you talking about. Bush did win the electoral vote. Thats how he became president. Do you think he lost both systems of voting and just happens to be the US\'s president????
